summary: This document provides a detailed overview of Jeffrey Epstein's life, including his career as a financier, his criminal proceedings, and various allegations of sexual abuse. It highlights his connections to prominent individuals and institutions, as well as the legal ramifications of his actions, including his plea deal and subsequent lawsuits. This document discusses allegations made by Virginia Roberts against Jeffrey Epstein, including claims of being trafficked and abused. It mentions various high-profile individuals, including Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz, who are implicated in the allegations. The document also references legal actions and media investigations related to Epstein's activities. This article discusses the rise and fall of Jeffrey Epstein, detailing his transition from a math teacher to a Wall Street investment banker and his subsequent legal troubles related to sex offenses. It highlights his connections with powerful figures and the allegations against him, including running a sexual abuse ring involving underage women.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the central figure in the document, detailing his career, criminal activities, and legal issues.

connections.description: Wexner was a significant client of Epstein's financial management firm.
Epstein and Zuckerman were equal partners in financing Radar magazine.
Roberts is one of the alleged victims of Epstein's sexual abuse.
Roberts made allegations against Prince Andrew regarding sexual misconduct.
Johnson accused Trump of sexual assault when she was a minor.
Virginia Roberts alleges that Jeffrey Epstein trafficked and abused her.
Virginia Roberts claims she was trafficked to Prince Andrew by Epstein.
Virginia Roberts has made allegations against Alan Dershowitz, who is taking legal action in response.
Both Prince Andrew and Alan Dershowitz are implicated in the allegations made by Virginia Roberts.
Wexner is identified as one of Epstein's clients who has since severed ties with him.

Ferguson is identified as the former wife of Prince Andrew and has expressed regret over her financial dealings with Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from underage girls and was sentenced to 18 months in prison.

events.title: Initial Allegation
events.description: A woman reported to police that her 14-year-old stepdaughter was taken to Epstein's mansion and paid for sexual acts.

events.title: Probable Cause Affidavit Filed
events.description: Palm Beach police filed a probable cause affidavit recommending charges against Epstein for unlawful sex with minors.

events.title: Judge's Ruling on Virginia Roberts Case
events.description: Judge Kenneth Main ruled that allegations made by Virginia Roberts against Prince Andrew had no bearing on a lawsuit seeking to reopen Epstein's plea agreement.

events.title: Lawsuit Dropped
events.description: Katie Johnson dropped her lawsuit against Epstein and Trump, citing fears for her safety.

events.title: Virginia Roberts' Allegations
events.description: Virginia Roberts alleges in a sworn affidavit that she was held as a sex slave by Epstein and trafficked to several individuals.

events.title: Trump Called as Witness
events.description: Reports indicate that President Donald Trump was called as a witness in a new case against Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Epstein was arrested after allegations surfaced regarding his solicitation of a minor for sex.

events.title: FBI Investigation
events.description: An FBI investigation was launched after prosecutors identified numerous young women who may have been illegally procured by Epstein.

events.title: Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein negotiated a plea deal with prosecutors, pleading guilty to a minor charge and serving a short sentence.

events.title: Ongoing Lawsuit
events.description: A lawsuit against the US government was filed by two of Epstein's alleged victims regarding the terms of his plea deal.

locations: Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Epstein was convicted in 2008 of soliciting an underage girl for prostitution and served 13 months in prison.
He was known to have connections with high-profile individuals, including Prince Andrew and Donald Trump.
Numerous allegations of sexual abuse involving minors were made against Epstein, leading to multiple investigations.
Epstein's financial dealings included managing assets for clients with over $1 billion in net worth.
He established the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation, which funded various scientific research initiatives.
Virginia Roberts alleges she was trafficked by Epstein to several high-profile individuals, including Prince Andrew.
Alan Dershowitz is taking legal action in response to allegations made by Virginia Roberts.
Donald Trump was reportedly called as a witness in a case against Epstein.
Epstein allegedly settled with Roberts out of court, as he did in several other lawsuits.
Epstein was arrested in 2005 after allegations of soliciting a minor for sex.
He was known for his connections with powerful figures including politicians and celebrities.
Epstein negotiated a plea deal in 2008, serving only 13 months of an 18-month sentence.
Allegations against Epstein include running a sexual abuse ring involving underage women.
Prince Andrew has publicly denied any wrongdoing in connection with Epstein.
